results.title: The Day the sun turned cold = Tianguo niezi
results.creator_credit: Pineast Pictures, Ann Hui and Yim Ho
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, this beautifully presented and directed suspenseful drama tells the bizarre tale of Guan Jing a young man who one day walks into his local police station and demands an investigation into the death of his father, who he believes was murdered by his mother 10 years earlier. Guan Jing is at first met with an amount of scepticism by the Captain of Police but gradually the Captain finds himself drawn into this story of intrigue and betrayal. Using flashbacks the audience is taken on a journey of discovery into the lives and emotions of Guan Jing, his mother and his father, superbly played by Tao Chung Wah, Si Ching Gao Wa and Ma Jing Wu respectively. The film does moves slowly, but the atmospheric cinematography of blues and misty whites, combined with an intense and involved story of murder, passion and family relationships will keep you fascinated to the end. Cinematography by Ho Yung. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: The Day off
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Derek Lamb and Sidney Goldsmith
results.brief_description: A day off allows us from routine existence, but it also prepares us for re-entering the workday world. In this animated film people relaxing on a beach are constantly being reminded of tragic events happening elsewhere. By the end of the day they are able to return to the real world and continue to ‘function’. (Awards: Melbourne)

results.title: The Day of the Concorde
results.brief_description: On 26 January 1976 Concorde carried its first paying passengers on a British Airways proving flight from Heathrow to Gander, Newfoundland. (An Air France Concorde took off at the same time, on a similar flight to Brazil.) This film captures this historic event, as the complement of VIP’s embark in the early morning and return in time for lunch.

results.title: The Day Jimmy's boa ate the wash
results.brief_description: A girl relates to her mother the bizarre chain of events that occurred as a result of Jimmy’s pet boa constrictor escaping during a class trip to a farm. Based on the book by Trinka Hakes Noble, illustrated by Steven Kellogg.

results.title: The Day begins
results.creator_credit: Keystone Film Company and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: Unable to play his part, Charlie is thrown out of the movie studio. In his efforts to return he disguises himself as a woman, causing havoc for the film crew and landing him in deep water ending with a chase through the Keystone sets. Cast includes Chester Conklin, Roscoe (Fatty) Arbuckle, Charles Murray.

results.title: The Day After
results.brief_description: The Day After strips much of the myth from atomic murder to reveal with stark reality the catastrophe of a nuclear holocaust and its torturous effect on a group of average “survivors”. A moving and devastating drama about the effects of nuclear was on the citizens of Lawrence, Kansas. Rated: PG

results.title: The Dawn of motoring
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum, Films of Today, John Wiles and Bill Mason
results.brief_description: Part one of a 6-part series “History of the motor car”. Covers the development of the motorcar from the invention of the wheel to 1895 when the first cars produced in commercial quantities appeared on the roads.

results.title: The Dawn of industry
results.creator_credit: British Information Services, Derek Stewart Productions and Gerard Bryant
results.brief_description: The history of the hovercraft’s development including an interview with its inventor, Christopher Cockerell. Various uses, both commercial and military, are shown, and some of its posible future applications are described.

results.title: The Date: an interactive movie
results.brief_description: Based on the ‘choose your own adventure’ books from the 1980’s, the outcome of this interactive movie rests with the user. The shy boy central character has managed to score a date with the girl of his dreams - it is up to the user to determine whether he is successful or a miserable failure.
